channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: New tent with rough sleepers pitched on the left hand side of Bursted Woods green hill (as you walk up and over crest from bottom of Swanbridge Road), 13th December
item.description:
People living rough, hanging washing, moving around in unsettling manner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Still tens of illegally parked lime bikes, 13th December
item.description:
Sort this out. Lawless, amateur, ill equipped, money grabbing, fly tipping Lime have once again turned and maintained a complete mess on Charlotte rd. no e de response to the mess they make. Get them off this road. They are unable to cope. A complete disgrace. We will not wait for them. If they do sort out how to make it work they can come backâ€¦ but for now get them off the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Charlotte Road, Shoreditch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Premier Corner j/w Salusbury Way NW6, 13th December
item.description:
Major pothole just after the zebra crossing at the junction of Premier Corner and Salusbury Way NW6, on the southeast bound carriageway. Causing vehicles to either swerve dangerously to avoid or take considerable damage to the underside of their vehicle. Also aware this has been reported several times since 24/11/2025.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Men set off huge fireworks, 13th December
item.description:
Saw 4 "men" setting off a large amount of fireworks in the park and they left their burnt out boxes in the park endangering animals. Please install cctv looking to and from that pathway because that park has been a haven for arsonists and antisocial behaviour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface, cracks and potholes down Ramillies Road are unacceptable, 13th December
item.description:
The road surface and cracks, potholes down the road are atrocious. I have reported this several times, this year and last year and you have still not done nothing . The cracks will be joining up soon. The pot hole you filled in at the top of the road Rowley Avenue end is a pothole again. You have resurfaced the other roads around us and diverted the traffic down our road and has made it even worse. The road is used as a cut through and the amount of traffic is getting worse and the road is terrible. I have lived here 20 years and it has never been resurfaced or repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 190, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7 street lights out, 13th December
item.description:
There are now 7 street lights out on Bexley road. Five of them are on a row. It's very dark and feels unsafe. It starts on the corner of rennets wood road and the last one is off on the corner in of parish gate drive.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bexley Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Road block and nobody on site!, 13th December
item.description:
Silver street has been blocked since 10th December and there is nobody on site working. This road block inconveniences everyone including staff who work at north middlesex hospital. Buses are not available and it is causing too much traffic on the side roads where cars are parked on both sides and cars travel in both directions. Nobody is working on the road, so please remove the road block with immediate effect or we will be forced to remove them ourselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sterling Way, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked crossing, 13th December
item.description:
Reported several times before. Following the leak in the road, a large number of leaves gathered in the water and remain. The drains on both roads appear to be blocked. The leaves are turning to mush and very slippery. They are building up on the tactile paving and you can not cross here without stepping in them. DANGEROUS FOR VISUALLY IMPAIRED AS TACTILE PAVING COVERED.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Abbey Wood Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
